resources.string: \u2022 A triangle with two congruent sides and congruent base angles.

• Has two congruent sides. 
• Has congruent base angles. 
• The unequal side of an isosceles triangle is usually referred to as the Base of the triangle. 
• When the 3rd angle is a right angle, it is called a "Right Isosceles Triangle" 
• The altitude is a perpendicular distance from the base to the topmost vertex. 
• Has an altitude which: 
		• Meets the base at a right angle, 
		• Bisects the apex angle, and 
		• Splits the original isosceles triangle into two congruent halves 
• If two triangles are congruent, then the angles opposite to them are also congruent.
